document_data.name: Detho's Libram
document_data.author: [[Detho]]
document_data.Description: It was a thin, red book of 22 pages. The cover consisted of the hide from a [[rothe]], which was dyed and stretched onto boards of wood. Brass hoops bound the parchment together.
document_data.History: Written by the mage [[Detho]], the book was left in the possession of [[Piergeiron the Paladinson|Piergeiron]], who stored it in the library within [[Piergeiron's Palace]] in [[Waterdeep]]. Famous mages such as [[Elminster Aumar]], [[Khelben Arunsun]], and [[Laeral Silverhand]] read the book and copied spells into their own personal collections. The book was last in the possession of [[Peregar]], who took the book with him during an ill-fated expedition into the Northlands. He was last scene near [[Yartar]], having disappeared within a ball of blue flame. The book may have survived the blast and its current location as of [[1359 DR]] was unknown.
document_data.Contents:
Each page within the book contained a spell, for a total of 22 spells. It contained the following spells:
:''[[burning hands]]'' • ''[[catapult (spell)|catapult]]'' • ''[[continual light]]'' • ''[[dancing lights]]'' • ''[[decastave]]'' • ''[[detect invisibility]]'' • ''[[detect magic]]'' • ''[[Detho's delirium]]'' • ''[[enlarge]]'' • ''[[erase]]'' • ''[[ESP]]'' • ''[[feather fall]]'' • ''[[flying fist]]'' • ''[[hold portal]]'' • ''[[jump]]'' • ''[[knock]]'' • ''[[light]]'' • ''[[mending]]'' • ''[[push]]'' • ''[[read magic]]'' • ''[[spider climb]]'' • ''[[unseen servant]]The spell ''push'' is listed in the entry for this book in ''[[Encyclopedia Magica Volume III]]'', page 1163, but was not included in ''[[Pages from the Mages]]''.
